title: unable to sync
body:
today i built my own first mining rig yay!
3x rx 570 4gb
win 10 64

im quite noobish in this area still but i dived into cryptocurrency, and im getting more and more excited every step i make

so...i've been trying to get my node to sync using geth for over 6 hours now

i see it importing entries n blocks, but after a while it gives out n error and retries and retries again 

errors change (maybe cause i tried several things?)

- peer not registered (I did, twice) 
- peer lied (i like that one lol). 
- block body canceled at own request (it wasnt me!) 
- retreived hash is invalid

can some1 help me pls, tnx

Geth version: tried 16 and 16.1

#### Expected behaviour
syncing


#### Actual behaviour
not syncing


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour


#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````
oh and it says "sync failed dropping peer"alot
Could you provide some logs? It takes a while to sync and can abort from time to time in between. That's not a problem by itself (peers may just disconnect, drop, etc).

ok, well i deleted geth, started over and now it looks like its syncing, less errors
been at it for over 3 hours now, its at block 285something, is that normal?

the errors i get are:

WARN [05-05|15:19:42] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=cec5ee338976a353 err="retrieved hash chain is invalid"
WARN [05-05|15:20:31] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"
WARN [05-05|15:21:53] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"
WARN [05-05|15:22:07] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"
WARN [05-05|15:22:21] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"

ERROR[05-05|14:55:08] Failed to unregister sync peer           peer=70dba1082c4783b9 err="peer is not registered"
ERROR[05-05|14:55:08] Peer removal failed                      peer=70dba1082c4783b9 err="peer is not registered"

WARN [05-05|16:06:40] Rolled back headers                      count=2048 header=2882756->2880708 fast=2843504->2843504 block=0->0
WARN [05-05|16:06:40] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="state data download canceled (requested)"
INFO [05-05|16:06:42] Imported new state entries               count=1    elapsed=4.033ms   processed=6506009 pe
seems to be syncing now, yes i get errors, but there is progress

it seems it is fixed, deleted the blockchain and started over, any idea how
long it might take to sync?

tnx for the reply


2017-05-05 15:29 GMT+02:00 Péter Szilágyi <notifications@github.com>:

> Could you provide some logs? It takes a while to sync and can abort from
> time to time in between. That's not a problem by itself (peers may just
> disconnect, drop, etc).
>
> —

Vriendelijke Groeten,

Tomas Teunis

hello Péter,

new issue, slow sync

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/14433

Im still syncing (after almost 24h), i looked around, and it shouldnt take
this long.
after last problem, i did  --removedb, and started again using --fast
--cache=2048 (i haven fast 8gb ram)

so now 24 hours later im here

INFO [05-06|11:07:29] Imported new chain segment               blocks=15
txs=227  mgas=6.781   elapsed=1.999s    mgasps=3.392  number=2219050
hash=37e03a…4e7b1a
INFO [05-06|11:07:35] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=75
percentage=84 elapsed=3.049s
INFO [05-06|11:07:35] Generated ethash verification cache      epoch=75
elapsed=3.331s
INFO [05-06|11:07:37] Imported new chain segment               blocks=66
txs=309  mgas=12.057  elapsed=8.002s    mgasps=1.507  number=2219116
hash=c4107f…6b3917

i had to restart, so fast sync is disabled

almost no errors, except these;
WARN [05-06|10:35:34] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="header
processing canceled (requested)"

is it possible to download the entire blockchain somewhere?!?

i just want to get started.

This issue should be fixed by https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/14449. A regression caused a thread lockup in the downloader, causing peers to get heavily dropped all over the place.
Im having similar issues as the OP. (on windows)
karalabe, is some relase with fix to hdd sync problem?

Happening to me right now. Typical patterns in log below.
Version: Geth/v1.7.0-unstable-6ca59d98/linux-amd64/go1.8.3
```
WARN [08-14|19:09:56] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="receipt download canceled (requested)"

and a bit later:

```

Can I provide any further information from the affected system?
Happens in version Geth/v1.7.0-unstable-24036563/linux-amd64/go1.8.3 too.

I have the same issue over heer.
I used geth --rpc --fast --cache=4096, but geth uses over 6GB memory!! CPU usage started around 50%, but after hour dropped to 5%. But harddisk usage contineously 100% causing slowing down PC. 

Error received: Synchronisation failed, dropping peer and "retrieved hash chain is invalid" etc.etc.
After 8 hours I had to kill geth because I couldn't even do my normally work on it (workingstation with 128MB double cluster 160MB/s server disks, 16G mem and 3Ghz 6core!).... why?
Even when trying to reconnect to peer (peer 4 of 4 failed, which can take couple of minutes to one hour) geth uses 100% hdd.. but following networkactivity its just around couple of kbs to some mbps... no 160MB/s? 
Killing the proces took 10 minutes (trying it again gives the message "already shutting down, interrupt more to panic times = 9".

Is it right downloading the chain for first time nowerdays takes hourssss?

EDIT:
Restarted it with cache=1024 and after couple of minutes geth uses already 1.6GB...
But with 1024 cache I haven't that much "header broke chain ancestry" , "download canceled" and "invalid hash chain" errors.
It's also a lot faster when one cames around... 

I have New Ethminer 0.9.41-genoil-1.1.6 pre-release Windows Binary by-the-way

HI, similar to me...but i run 
`geth --rpc --syncmode fast --cache=2048 --etherbase 0x0` 

and all works grate...but if i run the same with service:

`[Unit]
Description=Ethereum go client
[Service]
Type=simple
ExecStart=/usr/bin/geth --rpc --syncmode "fast" --cache=2048 --etherbase "0x0"
[Install]
WantedBy=default.target`

Is not sync, just errors...

I still have this same issue on Geth 1.7.2 and mist 0.9.3.

I have already deleted chaindata and started from the scratch. Didn't help. I'm stuck in the last blocks. 

Node.log is full of following type of errors:
INFO [12-12|16:01:29] Imported new state entries               count=1235 elapsed=4.544ms   processed=163859 pending=17306 retry=246 duplicate=878 unexpected=1285
INFO [12-12|16:01:30] Imported new state entries               count=1083 elapsed=4.784ms   processed=164942 pending=16666 retry=212 duplicate=878 unexpected=1285

INFO [12-12|16:01:40] Imported new state entries               count=376  elapsed=956.578µs processed=170721 pending=19648 retry=8   duplicate=878 unexpected=1285
Same as @tim0k :/
There are currently 57221457 entries. You just have to wait it out until all those trie nodes are downloaded. Deleting the chain data will just make it start over from zero.

I had the same issue, and it works when I used the geth [OTHERE OPTIONS] --fast https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/9883/why-is-my-node-synchronization-stuck-extremely-slow-at-block-2-306-843

Hi all I got the same ERROR on Ubuntu 16

INFO [04-19|22:07:55] Imported new state entries               count=7    elapsed=95.39µs   processed=6081546 pending=14114 retry=2   duplicate=0 unexpected=0
WARN [04-19|22:07:55] Rolled back headers                      count=2048 header=3228792->3226744 fast=3208169->3208169 block=0->0
ERROR[04-19|22:08:01] Failed to unregister sync peer           peer=72c028bbc06f1281 err="peer is not registered"

Restart 10 times and sync 3.1 mio entries

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37729697/39016061-78c86246-441f-11e8-95de-804f3218c797.png)
Rehashing: You just have to wait it out until all those trie nodes are downloaded.

Well, it's almost impossible to get a node in sync, trying for months.

./geth --nousb --syncmode full --nat upnp --mine --minerthreads 6 --etherbase "0xSOMETHING"

The original issue is fixed, closing this. 
@AdeilnAcinrst your logs indicate you're doing fast-sync, not full. Also, you seem to have a really bad network connection.  Please open a new ticket if problems persist (if more problems than expected while synching)
